As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience, but here are some steps that musicians may take to guarantee their instruments and sound equipment are working correctly at live performances:

1. Check and test equipment before the show: Musicians usually sound check their instruments and equipment before the show to ensure that everything is functioning correctly.

2. Use quality equipment: Musicians may invest in quality equipment to reduce the chances of technical issues or malfunctions during performances.

3. Work with experienced sound engineers: Working with an experienced sound engineer can help ensure that the equipment is set up properly and adjusted for optimal sound quality.

4. Always carry spare equipment: Musicians may carry backup equipment such as extra guitar strings, drumsticks, or even an extra guitar, in case of any technical difficulties or malfunctions.

5. Keep equipment clean and maintained: Regular cleaning, maintenance, and servicing of the equipment can help increase its lifespan, reduce the risk of breakdowns, and detect any issues before they affect the performance.

6. Use surge protectors and backup power: Surge protectors can protect equipment from power surges, and backup power can be used to ensure the show goes on, even if there is a power outage.

7. Practice, practice, practice: Finally, regular practice and rehearsals can help improve the musician's skills and reduce the risk of mistakes and equipment failure during the performance.
